group_1.textRight: Thanks for coming with me today.
I don't think I could have carried all this@lab equipment by myself...

group_1.textLeft: Don't mention it.
I'm helping out simply because I enjoy it.
I occasionally visit the school where@you're holding today's science show.
I work part-time with Maria in an afterschool@program, taking care of children.

group_1.textRight: Maria's mentioned it to me before.
I never would have expected you to@work part-time.
You've got a reputation around school for@being a proper young lady of a rich family.

group_1.textLeft: It's a social study. *Giggle*
What sort of experiment are you@going to do this time?

group_1.textRight: A big, flashy one that'll really wow the kids.

group_1.textLeft: Are you doing the dry ice and@soap bubble experiment again?

group_1.textRight: Again...? Have I told you about that...?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, umm...oh yeah!@[chara:305501:lipSynch_0][wait:1.2][chara:305501:cheek_0][chara:305501:face_mtn_ex_011.exp.json][chara:305501:motion_100][chara:305501:lipSynch_1]My little brother told me...

group_1.textRight: Huh, you have a brother?

group_1.textLeft: ...Ah, well, yes.
(I screwed up...)
(The current Hinano doesn't know@I have siblings...)

group_1.textRight: Sorry, I seem to be forgetting things lately.

group_1.textLeft: ...No, it's my mistake. This is the first time@I've mentioned it.
Actually, I have a cute little sister and@two cheeky little brothers.
(That was careless of me...@I need to watch my words.)
(If I'm not careful, I'll act the same way@that I used to around them.)

group_1.narration: "After rescuing the turtle, Urashima Taro was@welcomed into the undersea Dragon Palace."
"The fish fluttered and danced,@and there was plenty of delicious food.@Urashima Taro had a wonderful time!"
"However,@Urashima Taro soon finds himself@longing for home..."

group_1.textRight: It looks like we're a bit early.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, she's still in the middle of@reading to the kids.

group_1.textRight: Urashima Taro...
I thought it sounded familiar...@Now I remember.
The Drama Club did a parody of it once.

group_1.textLeft: ...You can remember that?

group_1.textRight: Oi, you're being rude.
No matter how forgetful I might be,
it's hard to forget a story that moving.
I happened to be there just as it was about to start,
so Maria and I decided to watch it together.
It was pretty interesting.
That version was set in modern times, and@it incorporated a lot of original elements.
The style of the writing was quite striking, too.

group_1.textLeft: (...So she still retains memories of the play...)
(Just...not the real reason she@went to see it...)
It had a lot of funny elements.
But the ending was unexpectedly@heartbreaking...

group_1.textRight: Hm? Was the ending...sad...?

group_1.textLeft: Huh?

group_1.textRight: Oh, welcome, you two.

group_1.textLeft: Done with the reading, Maria?

group_1.textRight: Yes, we'll have the science show after@a short break.

group_1.textLeft: You must have worked hard.

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Thank you.
So, what were you two talking about?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, we were discussing the ending of the@Drama Club's play we saw.
It's like Sae and I saw different stories.

group_1.textRight: Ah, if that's the case...
I heard the direction of the script was changed@just before the performance.

group_1.textLeft: There was a last-minute change...?

group_1.textRight: Now that you mention it...
You're right, the playwright did mention that@in her closing speech...

group_1.narration: "L-ladies and gentlemen,@thank you for coming to our show.@We apologize for the delay@in the start of today's performance..."
"I'd also like to thank the performers,@the lighting crew, the audio engineers, and@everyone behind the scenes for accommodating@the last-minute change in the final act...@Truly, thank you!"
"I hope we brought smiles to everybody's faces."

group_1.textRight: I didn't know that second-year student,@but she seemed pretty nervous to me.

group_1.textLeft: (Didn't know her, huh...?)
I see... That explains the disparity.
(I don't remember her telling me@anything about that...)
Indeed, she showed me the script before that.
Although, that story was quite unusual for her.
She didn't give it a happy ending...

group_1.textRight: Oh, I never knew you were acquainted with@that playwright girl.
You were close enough for her to show you@the script,
but you didn't watch the performance?

group_1.textLeft: No, I didn't.
I had planned to go, though.

group_1.narration: My memories are different from the ones@Hinano and Maria retain.
I have no one to blame for this situation but myself...@All because I made a shallow and arrogant wish...
